alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 26 at 4:21AM CDT until July 26 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Illinois, including the following areas, in south central Illinois, Washington IL. In southwest Illinois, Saint Clair. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall continue to train over sections of central and east-central Missouri, as well as southwest Illinois. Widespread amounts of 1 to 4 inches have been observed with localized amounts exceeding 9 inches. Thunderstorms are expected to continue through early this morning adding to these totals.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
